awd_titl_txt: NMR Spectrometry for an Improved Undergraduate Chemistry    Program
awd_abstract_narration: The quality of the chemistry program at Rosemont College has been               enhanced by the recent acquisition of a nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR)        spectrometer. The availability of this instrument is providing                  undergraduate students a broader experience with chemical phenomena and         a realization of the potential of NMR as a powerful tool for further            investigation. Implementation of these goals is accomplished in three           steps: (a) introduction of the basic concepts of NMR spectrometry               through experimentation followed by qualitative application to organic          structure determination; (b) remodeling of the advanced laboratory              sequence to include a series of comparative experimental projects using         NMR and other complimentary techniques, and (c) development of                  applications to undergraduate research projects.

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: ROSEMONT COLLEGE OF THE HOLY CHILD JESUS
